snippet: Xi Jinping gave his first speech as general secretary of the Communist Party, impressing many Chinese by avoiding slogans but giving no indication as to whether he favors fundamental reforms.
abstract: News analysis; Xi Jinping, giving first speech as general secretary of China's Communist Party, impresses many people with plain-spoken promise to address problems in country's ruling party and to improve citizen's lives, but offers few clues as to whether he favors fundamental reforms (Series: Changing of the Guard).

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting. Shi Da contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Xi Jinping gave his first speech as general secretary of the Communist Party, impressing many Chinese by avoiding slogans but giving no indication as to whether he favors fundamental reforms.

headline.seo: Xi Jinping Offers Few Hints of a Shift in Direction in China
headline.main: A Promise to Tackle China’s Problems, but Few Hints of a Shift in Path
headline.print_headline: A Promise to Tackle China’s Problems, but Few Hints of a Shift in Path
